alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 7:45PM CDT until May 28 at 11:48PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River At Mccook 1se affecting Red Willow County. Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson affecting Hitchcock County. .The flood waters will continue to decline. However there is a possibility there could be additional rainfall over the flood warning areas tonight. If that happens a small rise in water levels can be expected before they fall again. For the Republican River...including Mccook 1se, Stratton, Benkelman 1sw...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Frenchman Creek Near Culbertson. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Lowland areas near the vicinity of the gage will become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CDT Saturday was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 5.4 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.0 feet on 08/11/2019. &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 745 AM CDT.
